page.title: 07Asians Women's Dress
page.content: After putting on her "chania choli", or blouse and long petticoat, a lady wraps her saree round her,rather like the toga of the ancient Romans.It may be of silk, satin, tissue or French chiffon.Sarees may be worn by anyone, and are very beautiful.Young girls do not wear sarees but a three piece suit called a "salwar kammeez". The "salwar" is a long dress type garment with slits at the sides.The"kameez" is like a pair of trousers,often loose and baggy. Sometimes you can wear a "pyjama" with the "salwar".This is tight fitting, unlike the "kameez".(A "pyjama" is not something you wear at night, but "py" means leg and "jama" means clothing). Mostly a kind of scarf is also worn, a two and a half yard length of material called a "dupatta", which is wound round the neck.
